subject: Mental Health
title: The Amygdala Hijack
description: A 60-second lesson on The Amygdala Hijack.

hook.text: In trauma, the amygdala takes over the brain like a hijacker seizing the cockpit.

buildup.text: It fires threat signals so fast that the thinking brain can't intervene.

discovery.text: This is why trauma survivors react before they can think â€” the alarm bypasses logic.

twist.text: A harmless sound or smell can trigger a full survival response years later.

climax.text: The amygdala doesn't know the trauma is over. It stays frozen in that moment.

punchline.text: The alarm thinks the fire is still burning.

quiz.question: Why do trauma survivors react before they can think?
options: The amygdala bypasses the thinking brain
